meanings.definition: The state of being tired, bored, or lacking enthusiasm due to overexposure or excessive experience.
meanings.sent1: After watching the same movie over and over, he felt the jadednesses creeping in.
meanings.sent2: Her jadednesses towards school made it hard for her to focus in class.
meanings.sent3: The jadednesses of the old clown made his jokes fall flat.
meanings.sent4: The jadednesses of the veteran actor showed in his lackluster performance.
meanings.sent5: The jadednesses of the marathon runner were evident as he struggled to find motivation.

meanings.definition: The quality of being cynical or disillusioned, especially as a result of negative experiences.
meanings.sent1: His jadednesses towards politics made him skeptical of every promise.
meanings.sent2: The journalist's jadednesses were clear in her hard-hitting questions.
meanings.sent3: The jadednesses of the detective helped him see through the suspect's lies.
meanings.sent4: The jadednesses of the war veteran colored his view of the world.
meanings.sent5: The jadednesses of the teacher made her question the system's effectiveness.

meanings.definition: The feeling of weariness or apathy towards something that was once exciting or enjoyable.
meanings.sent1: The jadednesses she felt towards her favorite hobby saddened her.
meanings.sent2: His jadednesses towards social events made him prefer quiet nights at home.
meanings.sent3: The jadednesses of the child towards candy was a surprise to his parents.
meanings.sent4: The jadednesses of the traveler made him yearn for new adventures.
meanings.sent5: The jadednesses of the artist stifled her creativity.
